experience.description: Situated Conversational Recommendation - Investigating techniques related to large-scale pre-trained language models and multi-modal dialogue system with the goal of increasing user engagement in our dialogue system. By leveraging multiple types of information, we aim to create a more immersive experience for the user. Supervisor: Prof. Wenjie, Li

Conversational Recommender System - Investigated the problem of target-guided knowledge-aware recommendation dialogue and design a dialogue generation system to make high-quality recommendations through interactive conversations proactively and naturally. This work has been accepted by the 3rd Workshop of Knowledge-aware and Conversational Recommender Systems (KaRS 2021) and the 37th AAAI conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI 2023). Supervisor: Prof. Wenjie, Li

Machine Reading Comprehension - Proposed a Hierarchical global-aware Information Transmission mechanism, which makes use of the interaction between local-aware information and global-aware information to improve the effectiveness of the model. Employed a Memory Flow mechanism for storing and modifying information from historical questions and answers. The experimental results on CoQA datasets showed that our model obtained competitive results compared to the existing methods. Supervisor: Prof. Rong Pan

Conversational Machine Reading Comprehension - Proposed a Hierarchical Conversation Flow Transition and Reasoning (HCFTR) model for conversational machine reading comprehension. Designed a multi-flow transition mechanism to integrate global-aware information flow transition and make dynamic reasoning. Developed a multi-level flow-context attention mechanism to fuse multiple levels of hierarchical fine-grained representations and perform advanced reasoning. Supervisor: Prof. Min Yang

experience.department: Mobile Internet and Financial Big Data Lab
experience.description: Service-Oriented Computing - Designed a Group Preference based API Recommendation System using the Bayesian Personalized Ranking Model. Recommended appropriate APIs for Mashup (a new type of service in internet by integrating multiple sources or functions on the network). This work was also my undergraduate thesis's topic, given the award of the SYSU Excellent Graduation Thesis and accepted by International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE-2018) and IEEE Access-2019. Supervisor: Prof. ZiBin Zheng
